story.headline: Peatland Drainage Drives Persistent Emissions
story.summary: Drained peatlands release stored carbon through oxidation and fires, creating long-lived emissions sources.
story.climateImpact: Peat soils store large carbon stocks; when drained or burned, they emit CO₂ and amplify global warming.
causeEffect: Exposed peat oxidizes and releases CO₂
story.scaleContext: Southeast Asian peatlands hold some of the densest carbon stocks on Earth.
story.outlook: Without restoration, emissions continue and fire seasons become more severe.
